Description: Ostracon, small fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and faint traces of at least two lines of black-painted Greek text. Joined to EA 66273.
Curator's comments: Joins EA 66273 Being studied for publication by Bryan Kraemer. Cemeteries and Osireion Excavations Group
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393798) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393798)
